string-array.item: The List is a collaborative project to build a global collection of images that anyone can use
Photos you share with The List will be available for any person or organization to use, as long as they give you credit
You’ll be helping creators tell their stories – on Wikipedia, social media, in the news, or in campaigns.\n\nTogether were building a commons of creativity and knowledge for everyone

resources.string:
This app is developed by Creative Commons.

Through The List, organizations will provide lists of locations, people, and events that they need photographs of. And when users are in the right place at the right time, they can claim an item from the list and publish a photograph of it. 

Licensing and Attribution 
All images created and uploaded using the List can be used and re-used by anyone, so long as they attribute the work of the author. You set your attribution information here. The List uses Creative Commons’ CC BY “for attribution” license. 

Terms of Service 
See The List terms of service here. 
To opt out of Google Analytics, see your CCID account in your phone’s Settings. 

How to help and file a bug 
The List is an free software project of Creative Commons. Contributions are welcome; from writing code to filing bugs. Our GitHub repo is here.
